text: This Act may be called the Transplantation of Human Organs and Tissues Act, 1994.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: It applies, in the first instance, to the whole of the States of Goa, Himachal Pradesh and Maharashtra and to all the Union territories and it shall also apply to such other State which adopts this Act by resolution passed in that behalf under clause
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The text pertains to article 252 of the Constitution.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: In relation to any State or Union territory, a reference to the commencement of this Act means the date on which this Act comes into force in such State or Union territory.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: the stage at which all functions of the brain-stem have permanently and irreversibly ceased
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: a person in whom permanent disappearance of all evidence of life occurs, by reason of brain-stem death or in a cardio-pulmonary sense, at any time after live birth has taken place
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The provisions of this Act shall not be construed as unlawful any dealing with the body or any part of the body of a deceased person if such dealing would have been lawful if this Act had not been passed.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The removal of any human organ or tissue or both from the body of a deceased person in accordance with the provisions of this Act, and the removal of any human organ or tissue or both from the body of a deceased person in pursuance of such authority is not considered an offence punishable under section 297 of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860).
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: This Act applies to each of the Union territories.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The Central Government shall appoint one or more officers as Appropriate Authorities for each of the Union territories for the purposes of this Act.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: This Act
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The State Government shall appoint, by notification, one or more officers as Appropriate Authorities for the purposes of this Act.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The Appropriate Authority shall perform the following functions.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: This rule applies to entities that are required to register under section 15 of the Act, and those that need to renew their registration.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The term 'that section' refers to the previous section in the document.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: Registration under sub-section can be suspended or cancelled.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: This text pertains to the scope of the authority, which includes enforcing standards for hospitals engaged in organ removal, storage or transplantation and Tissue Banks; investigating complaints of breach of provisions under this Act or rules made thereunder; inspecting Tissue Banks and hospitals periodically; examining the quality of transplantation and follow-up medical care to persons who have undergone transplantation and persons from whom organs are removed; and undertaking other measures as prescribed.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: To enforce standards (as may be prescribed) for hospitals engaged in the removal, storage or transplantation of any human organ.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: To investigate any complaint of breach of any of the provisions of this Act or any of the rules made thereunder and take appropriate action.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: To inspect Tissue Banks periodically.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: To inspect hospitals periodically for examination of the quality of transplantation and the follow-up medical care to persons who have undergone transplantation and persons from whom organs are removed.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: To undertake such other measures as may be prescribed.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The Central Government and the State Governments, as the case may be, by notification, shall constitute an Advisory Committee for a period of two years to aid and advise the Appropriate Authority to discharge its functions.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The Appropriate Authority shall grant a certificate of registration to the hospital or tissue bank after holding an inquiry and satisfying itself that the applicant has complied with all the requirements of this Act and the rules made thereunder.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: If an applicant has not complied with the requirement of this Act and the rules made thereunder, it shall reject the application for registration.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: Every certificate of registration shall be renewed.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The Appropriate Authority may, suo motu or on complaint, issue a notice to any hospital or Tissue Bank.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: its registration under this Act should not be suspended or cancelled for the reasons mentioned in the notice.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The Appropriate Authority is satisfied that there has been a breach of any of the provisions of this Act or the rules made thereunder.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The Appropriate Authority may suspend or cancel the registration of a hospital or Tissue Bank if it is satisfied that there has been a breach of any of the provisions of this Act or the rules made thereunder.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The Appropriate Authority may suspend the registration of a hospital or Tissue Bank for such period as it may think fit or cancel its registration.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: This chapter pertains to Offences and Penalties.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: Any person who renders his services to or at any hospital and who, for purposes of transplantation, conducts, associates with, or helps in any manner in, the removal of any human organ
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for removal of human organ without authority

text: shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to 3[ten years and with fine which may extend to twenty lakh rupees]
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for removal of human organ without authority

text: imprisonment for a term which may extend to 3[ten years and with fine which may extend to twenty lakh rupees]
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for removal of human organ without authority

text: A registered medical practitioner who commits an offence under this rule will have his name reported to the respective State Medical Council, potentially leading to removal from the register for a period of 4 years for the first offence and permanently for subsequent offences.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for removal of human organ without authority

text: Any person who renders his services to or at any hospital
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for removal of human organ without authority

text: If a person conducts, or associates with or helps in any manner in the removal of human tissue without authority, he shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and with fine which may extend to five lakh rupees.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for removal of human organ without authority

text: punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and with fine which may extend to five lakh rupees.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for removal of human organ without authority

text: The text pertains to activities related to the supply, offer to supply, or seeking payment for human organs.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for commercial dealings in human organs

text: It is prohibited to make or receive any payment for the supply of, or for an offer to supply, any human organ.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for commercial dealings in human organs

text: It is prohibited to seek to find a person willing to supply for payment any human organ.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for commercial dealings in human organs

text: It is prohibited to offer to supply any human organ for payment.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for commercial dealings in human organs

text: It is prohibited to initiate or negotiate any arrangement involving the making of any payment for the supply of, or for an offer to supply, any human organ.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for commercial dealings in human organs

text: It is prohibited to take part in the management or control of a body of persons whose activities consist of or include the initiation or negotiation of any arrangement referred to in clause (d).
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for commercial dealings in human organs

text: It is prohibited to publish or distribute or cause to be published or distributed any advertisement inviting persons to supply for payment of any human organ, offering to supply any human organ for payment.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for commercial dealings in human organs

text: Whoever contravenes any provision of this Act or any rule made, or any condition of the registration granted, thereunder for which no punishment is separately provided in this Act, shall be punishable.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for contravention of any other provision of this Act

text: imprisonment for a term which may extend to 5[five years or with fine which may extend to twenty lakh rupees]
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Punishment for contravention of any other provision of this Act

text: Where any offence punishable under this Act has been committed by a company
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: Every person who, at the time the offence was committed was in charge of, and was responsible to, the company for the conduct of the business of the company, shall be deemed to be guilty of the offence and shall be liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: Provided that nothing contained in this sub-section shall render any such person liable to any punishment, if he proves that the offence was committed without his knowledge or that be had exercised all due diligence to prevent the commission of such offence.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: Nothing contained in sub-section is applicable.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: If an offence punishable under this Act has been committed by a company and it is proved that the offence has been committed with the consent or connivance of, or is attributable to any neglect on the part of, any director, manager, secretary
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: No court shall take cognizance of an offence under this Act except on a complaint made by— (a) the Appropriate Authority concerned, or any officer authorised in this behalf by the Central Government or the State Government or, as the case may be, the Appropriate Authority; or; (b) a person who has given notice of not less than sixty days, in such manner as may be prescribed, to the Appropriate Authority concerned, of the alleged offence and of his intention to make a complaint to the court.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: No court shall take cognizance of an offence under this Act except on a complaint made by— (a) the Appropriate Authority concerned, or any officer authorised in this behalf by the Central Government or the State Government or, as the case may be, the Appropriate Authority; or; (b) a person who has given notice of not less than sixty days, in such manner as may be prescribed, to the Appropriate Authority concerned, of the alleged offence and of his intention to make a complaint to the court.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: An offence punishable under this Act can only be tried by a Metropolitan Magistrate or a Judicial Magistrate of the first class.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: A complaint has been made under clause (b) of sub-section
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The court may, on demand by such person, direct the Appropriate Authority to make available copies of the relevant records in its possession to such person.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done in pursuance of the provisions of this Act.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Protection of action taken in good faith

text: This text pertains to legal proceedings against the Central Government and State Government.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Protection of action taken in good faith

text: No suit or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Central Government or the State Government for any damage caused or likely to be caused.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
topic: Protection of action taken in good faith

text: The Central Government may, by notification, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The text discusses matters that may be provided for in rules, including but not limited to: (a) conditions for donor authorization of organ or tissue removal before death, (aa) specific organs or tissues, (ab) documentation of authorization, (ac) applicability of duties to registered medical practitioners working in unregistered hospitals, (ae) qualification and experience of a technician.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994

text: The repeal shall, however, not affect the previous operation of the Acts so repealed or anything duly done or suffered thereunder.
law: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES ACT, 1994
